Ingredients:

  • 2 pounds chicken pieces (legs and thighs are commonly used)
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/2 cup vinegar (white vinegar or cane vinegar)
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 1 cup water
  • Salt to taste
  • Steamed rice, for serving

Instructions:

  1. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, bay leaf, and black peppercorns. Mix well to make the marinade.

  2. Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Let them marinate for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour in the refrigerator.

  3. Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat.

  4. Remove the chicken pieces from the marinade, reserving the marinade for later use. Add the chicken to the hot skillet and sear on all sides until browned. This step helps develop the flavors and texture of the chicken.

  5. Once the chicken is browned, pour the marinade and water into the skillet. Bring it to a boil.

  6. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the chicken simmer for about 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Stir occasionally to ensure even cooking.

  7. If desired, you can remove the chicken from the skillet and transfer it to a separate plate. Increase the heat to high and continue simmering the sauce until it thickens slightly.

  8. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning with salt if needed.

  9. Return the chicken to the skillet and coat it with the thickened sauce.

  10. Serve the Chicken Adobo hot with steamed rice. You can drizzle some of the sauce over the rice for added flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken Adobo, a classic Filipino fiesta dish!
